ComicInfo.Summary:
Satan's Bullet: A deadly feud between two Scotsmen is decided by one's ghostly ancestor.
Blood on the Speedway: Racing car driver Ollie pushes his rival from the speedway - with fatal consequences. He tries to overcome his hallucinations about phantom cars crossing his way and has to pay a high price.
The Ring of Horror: Because Gordon Grant has been a "student of the occult" and carelessly dedicated his life to a certain "cult of the beast" he has to die early. Tragically he won't stop coming back as a zombie to claim his wife until she is joined in death with him.
The Accusing Fiddle: A fiddle (made from the wood of a tree under which a murdered man was hidden) plays no music, but screams the name of the killer.
The Phantom Train: Train engineer John Mathews sees a ghost train coming behind him and then vanishing into thin air.
Graveyard of the Atlantic: Hundreds of ships have sunken off the coast of North Carolina.
The Vengeance Vat: Junk dealer Zane disposes not only of garbage, but of his brother and an old witch woman, too. His life is spoiled though when his wife turns into the witch and Zane is plagued by hallucinations. In the end he has to face his fate and is boiled in the cauldron.
ComicInfo.Title: Satan's Bullet; Blood on the Speedway; The Ring of Horror; The Accusing Fiddle; The Phantom Train; Graveyard of the Atlantic; The Vengeance Vat
ComicInfo.Penciller: John Celardo,Mike Sekowsky,Morris Marcus,Ray Osrin,John Celardo,Mike Sekowsky,Morris Marcus,Ray Osrin
ComicInfo.Inker: John Celardo,Aldo Rubano,Rocco Mastroserio,Ray Osrin,John Celardo,Aldo Rubano,Rocco Mastroserio,Ray Osrin
